newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan c/a surplus won't again be big issue--MOF.
newsitem.headline: Japan c/a surplus won't again be big issue--MOF.

text.p: Japan's current account surplus is unlikely to again become a major issue with other nations as the country's economic recovery is being led by domestic demand, Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka said on Friday.
"The current account balance is unlikely to become a problem. We've overcome economic management led by external demand and have returned to recovery centring on domestic demand," Mitsuzuka said.
He said Japan explained its basic economic management policy to the United States and other Group of Seven (G7) nations during the G7 meeting in late April in Washington.
Mitsuzuka said Japan is steadiliy carrying out economic structural reforms and it had urged leading nations to take a more long-term perspective on the issue.
